description: Join Shaun as he unpacks the most important stories of injustice, racism and corruption, but also tells you who's fighting back and how you can support and join them with practical action steps.

items.content:
This nation could absolutely stop these mass shootings or slow them down drastically, but it REFUSES to do the work.
Let me unpack and explain it.
To listen to today’s FULL EPISODE of The Breakdown go now to Apple Podcasts or Spotify and search for “The Breakdown with Shaun King.” Subscribe there for FREE and listen to the whole podcast.

items.title: Ep. 801 - I'm so tired of saying this...yet ANOTHER mass shooting in America.

items.content:
Last week, in broad daylight, on New York City's busy F train, a white man choked a Black man death in front of the entire train. It was one of the ugliest, most despicable acts of violence that I've ever seen. For over 4 minutes, Daniel Penny choked the literal life out of Jordan Neely. Until he died right there on the train. Other men held down Jordan's arms to prevent him from ever getting free of the brutal chokehold.
Daniel Penny should've been arrested on the spot. But, of course, he wasn't.
Let me unpack and explain it!
PLEASE BECOME A MEMBER of The North Star now @ TheNorthStar.com.To listen to today’s FULL EPISODE of The Breakdown go now to Apple Podcasts or Spotify and search for “The Breakdown with Shaun King.” Subscribe there for FREE and listen to the whole podcast.
If you are already on Apple Podcasts or Spotify, please subscribe, listen, share, leave reviews, and listen daily to the entire episode. The more of it you listen to, the better it is for us.
Love and appreciate you all.
Shaun

items.content:
Hey everyone, today on The Breakdown, we have another episode of The Momentum Advisors that originally aired on August 14th, 2022. I know we've all dreamed of hitting it big and winning millions of dollars, but have you ever stopped to think about how much money is really enough to make your ideal life a reality? Well, that's exactly what this episode explores. Tiffany and Allan break down a recent survey that asked people from 33 countries just how much money they would need to live their best lives. The answers might surprise you! And even if you don't win the Mega Millions jackpot, they offer some valuable insights on how to make it happen. So, tune in and let's talk about how we can all live our best lives, whether we hit the lottery or not.
To listen to today’s FULL EPISODE go now to Apple Podcasts or Spotify and search for “The Momentum Advisors Show.” Subscribe there for FREE and listen to the whole podcast (Episode 90).
Love and appreciate you all.
Shaun

items.title: Living My Best Life

items.content:
Hey everybody, we're bringing back an episode of The Momentum Advisors Show from February 28, 2021. In this episode, they break down passive and residual income--which is one of the keys to financial independence. I mean, who doesn't want to make money while they're sleeping or on vacation, right? They go into unique ways to generate meaningful residual and passive income, so that you can start living the life you want. Residual income comes from a single original action and it keeps coming in over and over again. And passive income requires little to no effort to maintain the cash flow. If you're ready to learn more about these types of income and how to start making them work for you, tune in to The Momentum Advisors Show today.
To listen to today’s FULL EPISODE of The Breakdown go now to Apple Podcasts or Spotify and search for “The Breakdown with Shaun King.” Subscribe there for FREE and listen to the whole podcast.
If you are already on Apple Podcasts or Spotify, please subscribe, listen, share, leave reviews, and listen daily to the entire episode. The more of it you listen to, the better it is for us.
Love and appreciate you all.
Shaun

items.content:
Friends, I'm excited to bring you a throwback episode of The Breakdown that originally aired on August 12, 2022.
You know, it's really astonishing to me that in America, when we look at the top 50 most represented people with monuments, half of them were enslavers. It's unacceptable.
But what's the solution? Waiting for others to create monuments for us isn't going to cut it. We need to take action and build them ourselves. That's what I address in this episode - specifically, building monuments to honor the legacies of Malcolm X and Nat Turner.
Take a listen and let me know your thoughts. 
To listen to today’s FULL EPISODE of The Breakdown go now to Apple Podcasts or Spotify and search for “The Breakdown with Shaun King.” Subscribe there for FREE and listen to the whole podcast.
If you are already on Apple Podcasts or Spotify, please subscribe, listen, share, leave reviews, and listen daily to the entire episode. The more of it you listen to, the better it is for us.
Love and appreciate you all.
Shaun

items.content:
Listen, I know the world is a hard place. And while the Internet, in some ways, is just a reflection of the world, I see way too many of us being mean as hell online.
I'm not talking about trolls and white supremacists. I'm talking about us. Even in my own comment sections I see way too much hatefulness, and what I would call "casual bigotry" coming from otherwise good people.
I have one simple strategy that I try to live out each and every day that I think could help some of us a whole lot right now.
Let me unpack and explain it.
To listen to today’s FULL EPISODE of The Breakdown go now to Apple Podcasts or Spotify and search for “The Breakdown with Shaun King.” Subscribe there for FREE and listen to the whole podcast.
If you are already on Apple Podcasts or Spotify, please subscribe, listen, share, leave reviews, and listen daily to the entire episode. The more of it you listen to, the better it is for us.
Love and appreciate you all.
Shaun

items.content:
Today I want to give you all a good news update on the health, condition, and healing of young Ralph Yarl. I'll also give you a few thoughts and updates on the criminal case against the man who shot Ralph.

Hey everyone, today we're revisiting an episode of The Breakdown that originally aired on July 14, 2022, but the question that we explored on that day is just as relevant now as it was then.
Why do we accept a system where we fully fund mass incarceration but fail to fully fund education and healthcare?
Budgets are moral documents that reflect our values and priorities as a society. Join me as we dig into this important topic once again and explore why we must demand better for ourselves and our communities.

Today, we're featuring another episode of The Momentum Advisors Show that first aired on October 16, 2022. In this episode, the hosts discuss the concept of symbiosis and how it can be a positive force for wealth building in the world of entrepreneurship. They focus on how small businesses and independent contractors can form symbiotic relationships with large enterprises to create a mutually beneficial partnership that allows both parties to make more money on their own terms. Join Allan Boomer and Tiffany Hawkins as they explore the world of wealth building through symbiotic relationships.

On today's episode of The Breakdown, we're revisiting an important topic in light of recent financial news. As the FDIC prepares to take over First Republic Bank, we're airing an episode of The Momentum Advisors that originally aired on March 19th. In this episode, they discuss what happens when banks fail and provide insight into the recent failures of Silicon Valley Bank and Signature Bank. They also delve into the history of bank failures in the US and offer tips on how to protect yourself if this happens to your bank in the future. It's a timely and informative episode that you won't want to miss.
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.content:
On some days I hate this place that we almost jokingly call "The United" States of America. United in what? Its determination to not make right its wrongs?
From 1955 until 2023 this nation had endless chances to try to provide a semblance of justice and accountability to the family of Emmett Till, but for 68 straight years, every DA, every prosecutor, every Attorney General, every staff of the DOJ, and every presidential administration that had a chance to do right by this family, REFUSED TO DO SO.
My best guess is that in the years ahead, now that no single living human being that participated in the lynching of Emmett Till is around to be held accountable, the government will eventually tell us what it should have done and offer an empty apology.
The whole ordeal is about the most American thing I think we will ever know.
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

On today's throwback episode, we're re-visiting one of our favorite episodes from Tiffany Hawkins & Allan Boomer from The Momentum Advisors. Have you ever thought about where your investment dollars are really going? Chances are, they're not being invested in the communities that matter most to you. In fact, they could be supporting institutions that go against your values, such as immigration, prison complexes, racism, and excess gun usage. In this eye-opening episode, we're asking the tough question: "Is Your Money Racist?" and providing you with the tools to take control of your investments and ensure they align with your values. Don't miss out on this important conversation.
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.content:
I'm nothing but glad Tucker Carlson was just fired from Fox News. The man was an open bigot. He was a white supremacist who employed other white supremacists. He's also a liar and a scoundrel. But I want us to pause for a quick moment and squeeze some lessons out of what just went down.
Because here's what I know - Fox News is going to replace one bigot with another bigot. This man wasn't fired for his racism, he was fired because he was costing the corporation a TON of money. Period. They were ALWAYS willing to endure his racism.
But let me unpack and explain what we really need to know about all of this.
PLEASE BECOME A MEMBER of The North Star now @ TheNorthStar.com.
To listen to today’s FULL EPISODE of The Breakdown go now to Apple Podcasts or Spotify and search for “The Breakdown with Shaun King.” Subscribe there for FREE and listen to the whole podcast.

Love and appreciate you all.

items.content:
Hello Listeners,⁣
⁣I promised Ahmaud’s dear mother, Wanda, that we could get 5,000 people to register for the 1st Annual Walk/Run with Maud 5K!⁣
⁣The proceeds go to helping her build the Ahmaud Arbery Foundation (follow NOW @ahmaudarberyfoundation) which is all about helping young Black boys get the mental health tools they need. ⁣
⁣ You can click the LINK IN MY BIO on IG or go straight to RunWithMaud.com to register.⁣
⁣

You can run in person in Atlanta. Or…⁣

You can participate ANYWHERE in the world. ⁣

Or you can simply register to show the love. ⁣

⁣
 I’d like to say something difficult. ⁣
⁣Ahmaud’s family hasn’t received a large settlement that they could’ve used to help them launch the foundation. They have us. That’s it. ⁣
⁣That’s why we need to have their back, OK?⁣
⁣Love and appreciate you all!⁣
⁣Shaun

It's time to stop being afraid to ask for help when it comes to your money. On this episode of The Momentum Advisors, our financial experts (Tiffany Hawkins & Alan Boomer) discuss the common mistakes people make with their finances and why it's so difficult to ask for financial help. They provide actionable tips and strategies to help you overcome your fears and get the financial help you need. Don't wait until it's too late, tune in now and take the first step towards financial success!

items.title: It's Time to Ask for Help

items.content:
Get ready to learn how to choose the best financial advisor for your needs with The Momentum Advisors. On this episode, Allan Boomer and Tiffany Hawkins provide valuable insight on the key questions you should ask your financial advisor. From sorting through their qualifications to learning their investment philosophy, these strategic questions will help you find the perfect match. Plus, they even provide answers to these questions to give you an idea of what to expect from a suitable financial advisor. Tune in to this episode for essential financial advice that you won't want to miss.
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.content:
Today I want to tell you just a little bit about my own personal journey with weed. I'm a late adopter and didn't start smoking all the way until I was 38 years old when my pain management doctor first prescribed it to help with my pain.
But once I started smoking or taking edibles, which I mainly prefer, it helped me truly see the human value of cannabis in a way that I never quite understood it before.
Let me unpack and explain it.
To listen to today’s FULL EPISODE of The Breakdown go now to Apple Podcasts or Spotify and search for “The Breakdown with Shaun King.” Subscribe there for FREE and listen to the whole podcast.
If you are already on Apple Podcasts or Spotify, please subscribe, listen, share, leave reviews, and listen daily to the entire episode. The more of it you listen to, the better it is for us.
Love and appreciate you all.
Shaun

items.title: Ep. 793 - A really GREAT update on the healing and recovery of Ralph Yarl

items.content:
Today is another GOOD NEWS episode of The Breakdown. In just 24 hours, not only did we raise nearly $3 million for young Ralph Yarl and his family, but we helped ensure that the bigot who shot Ralph was arrested and charged for his crimes.Hundreds of thousands of you made phone calls and sent emails that helped make that happen.
THANK YOU.
This is what we can do when we move in the same direction, with the same goal.
Let me unpack and explain it.
To listen to today’s FULL EPISODE of The Breakdown go now to Apple Podcasts or Spotify and search for “The Breakdown with Shaun King.” Subscribe there for FREE and listen to the whole podcast.
If you are already on Apple Podcasts or Spotify, please subscribe, listen, share, leave reviews, and listen daily to the entire episode. The more of it you listen to, the better it is for us.
Love and appreciate you all.
Shaun
9:30

items.title: Ep. 792 - When we organize, we can do amazing things :: An update on Ralph Yarl

items.content:
On this past Thursday, the unthinkable happened. An armed white man brutally shot a young Black boy over and over again after he rang the doorbell, just one street over from where he was supposed to pick up his younger brothers.
Today I am going to unpack and explain the case and give you some ACTION STEPS to follow. Let's GO!Let me unpack and explain it.
To listen to today’s FULL EPISODE of The Breakdown go now to Apple Podcasts or Spotify and search for “The Breakdown with Shaun King.” Subscribe there for FREE and listen to the whole podcast.
If you are already on Apple Podcasts or Spotify, please subscribe, listen, share, leave reviews, and listen daily to the entire episode. The more of it you listen to, the better it is for us.
Love and appreciate you all.

Allan Boomer and Tiffany Hawkins will guide you through the key factors you need to keep in mind before making the move. Don't miss out on this valuable insight. And be sure to tune in tomorrow for the next episode, where we'll continue the discussion on making strategic career moves.

We hear a lot of people talking about starting LLCs. Their goals when starting these legal structures is to create additional sources of income and to create a financial legacy for their families. In the end, many people are simply filing papers to start a business--without ACTUALLY starting the business. On this episode, we help you understand how to really start a business and guess what? It has nothing to do with paperwork.

If you are on the fence about therapy, I'd love for you to hear me out. And for those of you that are on a therapy journey, I hope something I share today helps you keep going.
Love y'all.
Shaun

HINT - it's not just because of Russian propaganda.
Russia has a VERY long history of truly supporting the continent of Africa when almost the entire white world was either standing down or literally doing the oppressing during colonization and Apartheid.
That's at the root here, but even beyond that, nations like Russia and China continue to provide billions of dollars not of "aid," but investment into massive development projects that again, most of the white world has ignored.And so, when Putin does something that I think is truly horrible in the invasion of Ukraine, and commits countless war crimes in the process, most African leaders are almost completely unwilling to call him out.
Let me unpack and explain it.

On Monday, 27 year old Justin Jones, after being chosen by the Nashville City Council to basically replace himself in the Tennessee State Legislature, was sworn in, and triumphantly returned to the floor of the Capitol.
Today, it's time for Memphis to choose 27 year old Justin Pearson to return and be sworn in. And barring any hiccups, that's exactly what we expect to happen.
Let me unpack and explain it.
To listen to today’s FULL EPISODE of The Breakdown go now to Apple Podcasts or Spotify and search for “The Breakdown with Shaun King.” Subscribe there for FREE and listen to the whole podcast.

items.title: Ep. 788 - Fingers crossed: It appears Justin Pearson will be sworn back into office in Tennessee TODAY!

items.content:
Yesterday, just days after they ousted and removed Tennessee State Representative Justin Jones from office, the City of Nashville voted to return him RIGHT BACK.
And it was a GLORIOUS sight to behold. After being sworn in before a crowd of THOUSANDS of people, Justin Jones, Black power fist raised in the air, marched right back onto the floor of the legislature, into the belly of the beast, in front of dozens and dozens of evil white men who voted to remove him.
And they HATED IT.These men just made Justin Jones into a national hero.
Let me unpack and explain it.
To listen to today’s FULL EPISODE of The Breakdown go now to Apple Podcasts or Spotify and search for “The Breakdown with Shaun King.” Subscribe there for FREE and listen to the whole podcast.
If you are already on Apple Podcasts or Spotify, please subscribe, listen, share, leave reviews, and listen daily to the entire episode. The more of it you listen to, the better it is for us.
Love and appreciate you all.
Shaun

items.title: Ep. 787 - I can't recall a time where I saw more absolutely disgusted white men than I did yesterday

items.content:
I know the conservative white supremacists in the Tennessee State Legislature thought they were teaching these two young Black men a lesson, but the truth is that the bravery of these two young brothers taught the entire world a lesson.
When used in the right place, at the right time, non-violent civil disobedience functions as both a mirror and spotlight on the bigotry of this country - showing the nation just how racist it truly is.
Let me unpack and explain it.
To listen to today’s FULL EPISODE of The Breakdown go now to Apple Podcasts or Spotify and search for “The Breakdown with Shaun King.” Subscribe there for FREE and listen to the whole podcast.If you are already on Apple Podcasts or Spotify, please subscribe, listen, share, leave reviews, and listen daily to the entire episode. items.content:
Today, we're excited to share another episode of The Momentum Advisors, an The North Star production that's all about empowering you to take control of your financial future. Be sure to find and subscribe to The Momentum Advisors on your favorite podcasting platform!
Original Airdate: September 25, 2022
Most people have a basic understanding of how to invest their money: open an account, buy some stocks, bonds, or other investment vehicles. Well, there's a lot more you need to know before you take these two steps, that are crucial to your overall investment plan. And guess what? Most people don't know them and miss out on all the real benefits to investing. On this episode we tell you the most important thing you need to know when getting started with investing your money.

Most people don't know them and miss out on all the real benefits to investing. On this episode we tell you the most important thing you need to know when getting started with investing your money.

items.content:
Join Allan Boomer and Tiffany Hawkins on The Momentum Advisors Show as they share their wealth of knowledge and expertise on financial literacy and empowerment. With actionable insights and practical tips, they'll guide you towards making smart financial decisions and achieving financial freedom. Don't miss this episode, it's packed with valuable information you won't want to miss!
Chances are, you've heard of the term "compound interest," but do you know how it really works? If not, you're in the majority: 69% of Americans don't understand it. Compound interest is the "magic pill" that converts your "modest savings" into massive wealth. Through the power of compound interest is how most "everyday" people become millionaires. On this episode we are breaking down how compound interest
works and how to make it work for you--at any age.

items.title: Where the Money Resides: Compound Interest

items.content:
As you have no doubt heard by now, the state legislature in Tennessee, on a near party-line vote, decided to steal expel and remove 2 young Black legislators not just from the room, but from their elected office. It's an abomination.
American democracy has always been more of an ideal and aspiration than a reality. But the covers were pulled off yesterday. And something that I have never seen in my lifetime happened. Today I want to shine a light on the bravery of Justin Jones and Justin Pearson and tell you what I think will happen next.
Let me unpack and explain it.
To listen to today’s FULL EPISODE of The Breakdown go now to Apple Podcasts or Spotify and search for “The Breakdown with Shaun King.” Subscribe there for FREE and listen to the whole podcast.
If you are already on Apple Podcasts or Spotify, please subscribe, listen, share, leave reviews, and listen daily to the entire episode. The more of it you listen to, the better it is for us.
Love and appreciate you all.
Shaun

items.title: Ep. 785 - SHAME SHAME SHAME on the Tennessee Legislature

items.content:
Hey Breakdown Crew! We've been rocking together now for over 4 years and have gotten SO MUCH good done together. Today is one of those days where I need each of us to show up, OK?
Have you heard the name LaKeith Smith?
When he was just a 15 year old boy, police shot and killed his best friend, but prosecutors then went and charged LaKeith, who they openly admit was unarmed and non-violent, with his murder. It's an abomination. I already hate the felony murder rule, but I have NEVER seen it applied in this outrageous fashion.
LaKeith was then sentenced to nearly 70 years in prison after police shot and killed his friend.
And I have promised his dear mother, Tina, that we would raise enough money for her to take off of work for the next year so that she can fight full time to get her son free.
Please, go now to my Instagram page, and CLICK THE LINK IN MY BIO to chip in. We're already past 50% of the goal but predict we need 1,800 more donors to cross the finish line.
Let's do this!
To listen to today’s FULL EPISODE of The Breakdown go now to Apple Podcasts or Spotify and search for “The Breakdown with Shaun King.” Subscribe there for FREE and listen to the whole podcast.
If you are already on Apple Podcasts or Spotify, please subscribe, listen, share, leave reviews, and listen daily to the entire episode. The more of it you listen to, the better it is for us.
Love and appreciate you all.
Shaun

items.title: Ep. 784 - This might be the single most outrageous injustice in America right now

items.content:
Far right conservatives in this country have been allowed to define the narrative about who the DA that's prosecuting the leader of their cult, Donald Trump.
They are saying that Alvin Bragg is a far-left radical. That he is doing what he's doing because he wants to interrupt Trump's ability to become President. That he is loyal to Joe Biden.But all of that is bogus. Lies. Let me tell you who he really is. I've known him for the past 10 years.
To listen to today’s FULL EPISODE of The Breakdown go now to Apple Podcasts or Spotify and search for “The Breakdown with Shaun King.” Subscribe there for FREE and listen to the whole podcast.

items.title: Ep. 783 - Let me tell you what I know about Manhattan's District Attorney, Alvin Bragg

items.content:
Should Trump be the focus of the news 24/7? Of course not. But I understand why having the former president placed under arrest would dominate the news today. The problem is two-fold, though. It's going to dominate the news for weeks and months to come, even when it shouldn't, because it's clearly good for their ratings. And when Trump becomes the primary focus of the news, VERY VERY important stories end up not being told.
Like what's happening in the Tennessee legislature as we speak. It's one of the closest things to fascism we've ever seen. At least 3 duly elected Democratic State Representatives are about to literally be removed from their positions because they participated in a peaceful protest about gun control. First their key cards were disabled and now legislation has been drafted to remove them from the legislature...permanently.
It's a scary thing - and makes me very concerned about the path we might be going down right now.
Let me unpack and explain it.
To listen to today’s FULL EPISODE of The Breakdown go now to Apple Podcasts or Spotify and search for “The Breakdown with Shaun King.” Subscribe there for FREE and listen to the whole podcast.
If you are already on Apple Podcasts or Spotify, please subscribe, listen, share, leave reviews, and listen daily to the entire episode. The more of it you listen to, the better it is for us.
Love and appreciate you all.
Shaun

items.title: Ep. 782 - On the day of Trump's arrest, let me tell you the SECOND most important news story. It's pretty damn urgent.

items.content:
I hate to say this, but racism is so deeply ingrained into every fiber of this nation's being that it seems like no matter how hard some of us try, we just can't escape it. And sure enough, it reared its ugly head last night during the NCAA Women's Basketball Championship.
Today I'll break it all down, but if you hadn't heard, the basics are this: A star white player for Iowa has talked MAJOR trash all year and been celebrated for it - no matter how brash, crass, or over the top it was. But when a rival player from LSU talked that same brash trash right back to her, white folk simply lost their minds. The double standard was brutal. And it was just a painful reminder that even when we are seeking a form of escapism through sports, that bigotry is just lurking right their beneath the surface.
Let me unpack and explain it.
To listen to today’s FULL EPISODE of The Breakdown go now to Apple Podcasts or Spotify and search for “The Breakdown with Shaun King.” Subscribe there for FREE and listen to the whole podcast.
If you are already on Apple Podcasts or Spotify, please subscribe, listen, share, leave reviews, and listen daily to the entire episode. The more of it you listen to, the better it is for us.
Love and appreciate you all.
Shaun

Today I'll break it all down, but if you hadn't heard, the basics are this: A star white player for Iowa has talked MAJOR trash all year and been celebrated for it - no matter how brash, crass, or over the top it was. But when a rival player from LSU talked that same brash trash right back to her, white folk simply lost their minds. The double standard was brutal. And it was just a painful reminder that even when we are seeking a form of escapism through sports, that bigotry is just lurking right their beneath the surface.

Let me unpack and explain it.

To listen to today’s FULL EPISODE of The Breakdown go now to Apple Podcasts or Spotify and search for “The Breakdown with Shaun King.” Subscribe there for FREE and listen to the whole podcast.

If you are already on Apple Podcasts or Spotify, please subscribe, listen, share, leave reviews, and listen daily to the entire episode. The more of it you listen to, the better it is for us.

Love and appreciate you all.

Shaun

items.title: Ep. 781 - White men LOST THEIR MINDS when a Black woman athlete did the same thing they celebrated a white woman for

items.content:
Today, we're excited to feature "The Momentum Advisors Show" with Allan Boomer and Tiffany Hawkins. In this show, you'll gain valuable insights into financial literacy, empowerment, decision-making, and achieving financial freedom. We can't wait for you to hear it!
In the aftermath of mass shootings, many Americans want to do something--anything--to help but, feel helpless. Petitions, donations and voting are all clear ways to start a path towards change but there is a very effective and immediate impact you can have from the comfort of your living room: changing your investments. Most investors are completely oblivious to how they are--and have been--funding gun production and warfare through their retirement accounts and investment portfolios. On this episode we tell you exactly how to uncover if/where this applies to you and how to defund these organizations in real time.

items.title: Your Investments are (Probably) Funding Gun Violence

items.content:
Today, we're excited to feature "The Momentum Advisors Show" with Allan Boomer and Tiffany Hawkins. In this show, you'll gain valuable insights into financial literacy, empowerment, decision-making, and achieving financial freedom. We can't wait for you to hear it!
The terms "ESG", "socially responsible" and "impact investing" are ongoing buzzwords in the financial services industry. But what does it all actually mean? Regardless of the confusing industry jargon, the essence of it all is aligning your portfolio with your values—without sacrificing returns. More than that, it presents greater opportunity for you to see stronger returns. On this episode, we teach you how to do it whether you're dealing with a financial advisor, HR department or you self-manage your investments.
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.content:
Every single day of the week, I have friends that work for the NY Times, CNN, MSNBC, and other major news outlets that tell me the same story. It goes something like this:
"Shaun, I would get fired if I said what you say. We can't call out the Apartheid of Israel. We aren't even allowed to call it Palestine. We can't call out the Democratic Party and we damn sure can't call out Joe Biden. And time and space are RARELY made to cover police violence and white supremacy like you do."
That right there, is why we have this podcast. It's why we started The North Star.
And it's WHY I am asking you to PLEASE become a new paid member to support our work TODAY! For the next 31 days we are going to be fighting, kicking, scratching, clawing our way to get just 6,000 NEW PAID MEMBERS @ TheNorthStar.com and I am asking YOU, yes you, to join us.
We simply won't be able to continue doing what we do without hitting that goal!
If you have ever enjoyed this podcast, my articles, or anything good you see me doing in the world, please become a member now @ TheNorthStar.com.You can join for as little as $8.
You can cancel anytime.
You can become a monthly or annual member.
And all of what you pay goes to underwrite the cost of our staff, our hardware, our software, and all of the other costs of doing what we do.
We are only able to be so damn fearless because we aren't funded by big corporations. We aren't funded by big investors or funds. We are FULLY INDEPENDENT.
So, get us closer to our goal and join today @ TheNorthStar.com!
Love and appreciate you all!
Shaun

items.title: How we are able to do what we do

DATE: Every single day of the week

items.content:
While it's HUGE news around the world, it's hardly gotten any coverage here in the United States. Right on the border with the US, where the United States is refusing to allow immigrants in, a new crisis is forming in Mexico.
Thousands of immigrants that expect to be seen and processed in the United States are piling up in Mexico, which is not remotely prepared to house them.
So, in a makeshift jail on the American border, nearly 40 immigrants, including, men, women, and children were all burned to death in a completely preventable fire. It's a human rights catastrophe. And it was completely preventable.
Let me unpack and explain it.
To listen to today’s FULL EPISODE of The Breakdown go now to Apple Podcasts or Spotify and search for “The Breakdown with Shaun King.” Subscribe there for FREE and listen to the whole podcast.
If you are already on Apple Podcasts or Spotify, please subscribe, listen, share, leave reviews, and listen daily to the entire episode. The more of it you listen to, the better it is for us.
Love and appreciate you all.
Shaun

items.content:
We just learned late last night that the shooter in Nashville purchased an astounding 7 guns, including multiple assault rifles, from 5 different stores across Tennessee, and loaded up on tons of ammunition... all while being treated and evaluated for severe mental health issues.
And no red flag was raised. WHY?
Because conservatives in Tennessee fought against all red flag laws and made it one of the easiest places IN THE WORLD to purchase guns.
Let me unpack and explain it.
To listen to today’s FULL EPISODE of The Breakdown go now to Apple Podcasts or Spotify and search for “The Breakdown with Shaun King.” Subscribe there for FREE and listen to the whole podcast.
If you are already on Apple Podcasts or Spotify, please subscribe, listen, share, leave reviews, and listen daily to the entire episode. The more of it you listen to, the better it is for us.Love and appreciate you all.
Shaun

We just learned late last night that the shooter in Nashville purchased an astounding 7 guns, including multiple assault rifles, from 5 different stores across Tennessee, and loaded up on tons of ammunition... all while being treated and evaluated for severe mental health issues.
And no red flag was raised. WHY?
Because conservatives in Tennessee fought against all red flag laws and made it one of the easiest places IN THE WORLD to purchase guns.
Let me unpack and explain it.
To listen to today’s FULL EPISODE of The Breakdown go now to Apple Podcasts or Spotify and search for “The Breakdown with Shaun King.” Subscribe there for FREE and listen to the whole podcast.

items.content:
It happened again. Yet another school shooting in America. Over and over and over again. We keep seeing them. They rips schools and communities apart.
And as always, nothing substantive gets done about it.
Today I want to push the conversation forward some and try to expound on WHY nothing gets done on this issue. It's not as simple as we make it out to be. It's not just the NRA. It's much deeper.
Let me unpack and explain it.

items.content:
As it stands right now, Israel might have the single most conservative government in the world. It's partly what allows them to oversee such a despicable system of Apartheid.
But as we speak, protests have completely brought the entire country to a standstill. People are resigning from government jobs, businesses are shutting down, flights are being canceled - all because the far-right government is trying to change the laws to allow them to completely take over the judiciary.
I support the protests. Injustice anywhere is always a threat to justice everywhere. However, it's wild knowing that these same people protesting have never protested with this much vigor against the Apartheid in their nation. And that if Palestinians came close to protesting like this, they'd be shot and killed.
Let me unpack and explain it.
To listen to today’s FULL EPISODE of The Breakdown go now to Apple Podcasts or Spotify and search for “The Breakdown with Shaun King.” Subscribe there for FREE and listen to the whole podcast.
If you are already on Apple Podcasts or Spotify, please subscribe, listen, share, leave reviews, and listen daily to the entire episode. The more of it you listen to, the better it is for us.
Love and appreciate you all.
Shaun

items.content:
On today's special episode of The Breakdown I want to introduce to some of you, and reintroduce to others, my dear friends Allan Boomer and Tiffany Hawkins of Momentum Advisors who give some of the smartest financial advice around. At The North Star we are proud to produce The Momentum Advisors show and today we are playing a full episode for you to check out. They are amazing. My wife and I learn so much from them each and every week and know you will too.
You can listen to their podcast on Apple Podcasts and Spotify and subscribe there for free by searching for "Momentum Advisors." Please also leave a great review for them, OK?
Episode Title: The Mis-education (of All of us)
"The Mis-education of the Negro, written in 1933, describes how the educational system in America was designed to teach Black people that we are inferior. Leveraging quotes from the book, we explore ALL of the ways we ALL have been Mis-educated in regards to careers, achievement, entrepreneurship and wealth-building."
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.title: A special crossover episode with Momentum Advisors!

items.content:
Listen - they have money for what they believe in. They make money magically appear for the things they actually care about. If you ever want to know the true heart and priorities of a person (or company or government) just look at their budget. Period.
And in a state that is STRUGGLING to cover healthcare costs and educational costs, suddenly they have a billion dollars to spare on mass incarceration.
Today, I'm going to unpack and explain just how corrupt this all actually is.
To listen to today’s FULL EPISODE of The Breakdown go now to Apple Podcasts or Spotify and search for “The Breakdown with Shaun King.” Subscribe there for FREE and listen to the whole podcast.

items.title: Ep. 776 - Alabama just agreed to spend $1 BILLION DOLLARS on a new mega-prison.

items.content:
I thought conservatives were the party of "law and order," right? But if that was the case, why would they be melting down at the mere possibility of Donald Trump being held accountable for his obvious crimes?
The answer is obvious - when they call for "law and order" they mean it mainly for African Americans and immigrants of color. They don't actually love police. It's why they had no problem beating the life out of police all over the Capitol - and refused to honor any of the police that stood up against Trump supporters.
They only love police when they are arresting or even killing Black folk. Anything else goes against their core values. And having an African American District Attorney, Alvin Bragg, holding Trump accountable is causing their brains to be overloaded.
Let me unpack and explain it.
To listen to today’s FULL EPISODE of The Breakdown go now to Apple Podcasts or Spotify and search for “The Breakdown with Shaun King.” Subscribe there for FREE and listen to the whole podcast.
If you are already on Apple Podcasts or Spotify, please subscribe, listen, share, leave reviews, and listen daily to the entire episode. The more of it you listen to, the better it is for us.
Love and appreciate you all.
Shaun

As their dear leader is nearing arrest, I have one simple question for conservatives. And I think this question gets to the heart not only of who they are, but what they actually believe about law and order, mass incarceration, policing, and so much more.
Let me unpack and explain it.

items.content:
It appears that Donald Trump, the 45th President of the United States, is going to be arrested this week. Like most of you, I'll believe it when I see it, but it does indeed appear as if this is about to happen.
I have at least 3 things I want you to know about this case and the likely arrest that's going to follow. It could get dangerous.
Let me unpack and explain it.
To listen to today’s FULL EPISODE of The Breakdown go now to Apple Podcasts or Spotify and search for “The Breakdown with Shaun King.” Subscribe there for FREE and listen to the whole podcast.

items.title: Ep. 773 - 3 things to know about Donald Trump's impending arrest

items.content:
Exactly 1 month ago today, a wonderful Black couple and their 5 sweet babies, were traveling from Georgia to Chicago for a family funeral when they were pulled over by Tennessee Highway Patrol on a bogus traffic stop for "staying in the left lane and not actively passing someone."
In other words, driving while Black.
The children, which include a newborn, a 2 year old, a 3 year old, a 5 year old, and a 7 year old were asleep in the back. Police then arrested the father for possession of a tiny amount of weed - a misdemeanor - that is legal in much of Georgia but not Tennessee - and instructed the mother to drive to the local "justice center" to bail out the father.
When the mother got there, it was a trap. Police and Child Protective Services surrounded her and forcefully took all of her kids, including her breastfed baby. My blood is boiling just typing these words.
Police had lied and said the mother was arrested and called Child Protective Services to get the children. But she wasn't under arrest and had committed no crime.
That was a month ago - and the state STILL has their kids.
Let me unpack and explain it.To listen to today’s FULL EPISODE of The Breakdown go now to Apple Podcasts or Spotify and search for “The Breakdown with Shaun King.” Subscribe there for FREE and listen to the whole podcast.
If you are already on Apple Podcasts or Spotify, please subscribe, listen, share, leave reviews, and listen daily to the entire episode. The more of it you listen to, the better it is for us.
Love and appreciate you all.
Shaun

items.content:
In this throwback episode, we revisit the important question of how to measure success for Black America. Together, we'll explore the metrics that really matter when it comes to moving our community forward. Is it home ownership? Is it college education? Is it the number of people killed by police or incarcerated? Or is it wealth? We'll delve into the outcomes and numbers that truly show whether we're making progress as a people. Join us as we re-examine this critical issue and consider the 5-10 things we should be fighting for to achieve a better future for all.
To listen to today’s FULL EPISODE of The Breakdown go now to Apple Podcasts or Spotify and search for “The Breakdown with Shaun King.” Subscribe there for FREE and listen to the whole podcast.
If you are already on Apple Podcasts or Spotify, please subscribe, listen, share, leave reviews, and listen daily to the entire episode. The more of it you listen to, the better it is for us.
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.title: How do we measure success for Black America?

items.content:
Last night, I was up late thinking about what appears to be a horrible case of injustice deep in Mississippi. Hours earlier I was thinking about a horrible case of injustice in Buffalo. And hours before that, and before that, and before that I was being contacted about egregious cases of injustice from coast to coast.
And I felt a bit overwhelmed, in great part, because it appears to me that the problems we hate the most seem determined to stay here forever.
Why is that?
Today I want to unpack and explain 3 reasons we struggle to build the systems and structures we actually need to produce deep, lasting change.
To listen to today’s FULL EPISODE of The Breakdown go now to Apple Podcasts or Spotify and search for “The Breakdown with Shaun King.” Subscribe there for FREE and listen to the whole podcast.
If you are already on Apple Podcasts or Spotify, please subscribe, listen, share, leave reviews, and listen daily to the entire episode. The more of it you listen to, the better it is for us.
Love and appreciate you all.
Shaun

items.content:
War is hell. And the war in Ukraine is no different. Russia has already created nearly 10 million Ukrainian refugees. Entire towns have been destroyed. Tens of thousands if not hundreds of thousands of people have been killed.
That's ALWAYS what war does. But I think my take on this war might surprise you.
Let me unpack and explain it.
To listen to today’s FULL EPISODE of The Breakdown go now to Apple Podcasts or Spotify and search for “The Breakdown with Shaun King.” Subscribe there for FREE and listen to the whole podcast.
If you are already on Apple Podcasts or Spotify, please subscribe, listen, share, leave reviews, and listen daily to the entire episode. The more of it you listen to, the better it is for us.

items.title: Ep. 770 -  I am fundamentally anti-war, but I think my take on Ukraine might surprise you.

items.content:
As the executives of Silicon Valley Bank privately rushed to give themselves their annual bonuses and sell their stock in the company, the general public had NO IDEA the bank was about to crash.
It's one of the largest single banks to crash in American history. And in some ways Silicon Valley Bank not only knew it was going to happen, they helped cause it by alerting their biggest investors, who in turn told of their friends to take all of their money out of the bank as soon as they could - which caused it to literally collapse overnight.
Now, the same people that refuse to bail out Americans that need student loan debt relief or universal healthcare are saying the federal government should bail out this bank.
HELL NO!
Let me unpack and explain it.
To listen to today’s FULL EPISODE of The Breakdown go now to Apple Podcasts or Spotify and search for “The Breakdown with Shaun King.” Subscribe there for FREE and listen to the whole podcast.
If you are already on Apple Podcasts or Spotify, please subscribe, listen, share, leave reviews, and listen daily to the entire episode. The more of it you listen to, the better it is for us.
Love and appreciate you all.
Shaun

And in some ways Silicon Valley Bank not only knew it was going to happen, they helped cause it by alerting their biggest investors, who in turn told of their friends to take all of their money out of the bank as soon as they could - which caused it to literally collapse overnight.
Now, the same people that refuse to bail out Americans that need student loan debt relief or universal healthcare are saying the federal government should bail out this bank.
HELL NO!
Let me unpack and explain it.
To listen to today’s FULL EPISODE of The Breakdown go now to Apple Podcasts or Spotify and search for “The Breakdown with Shaun King.” Subscribe there for FREE and listen to the whole podcast.
If you are already on Apple Podcasts or Spotify, please subscribe, listen, share, leave reviews, and listen daily to the entire episode. The more of it you listen to, the better it is for us.
Love and appreciate you all.
Shaun

items.title: Ep. 768 - 2023 is now on pace to be the deadliest year ever measured for police violence, but the media is nearly silent

items.content:
Am I surprised? No. But am I disgusted down to my bones? Absolutely. After begging and pleading for Black votes... After wearing Kente cloth and taking a knee for injustice in America... After marching and protesting against injustice - the Democratic Party just spit in the face of Black leaders, Black voters, and Black people in general.
Let me explain. The Washington DC City Council voted 12-1, in a near unanimous vote, to pass important criminal justice reforms for the city. And I say this with all due respect to the City Council, but the reforms are moderate. They aren't revolutionary or radical. They are basic.DC is a majority Black city. The City Council is a majority-Black body. And suddenly after they passed these reforms, rich white people in the city flipped out. Then conservatives flipped out. And that's an important observation to make, because it was seeing this that caused the conservative media to flip out. Which in turn caused Republicans in Congress to say they were going to do something that has not been done since 1991. They were going to use their power in Congress to overturn the Washington DC City Council. Since DC is not a state, Congress has this weird power, but it's RARELY used.
The thing is, they would need Biden and some more Democrats to side with them - and after pressure, they've agreed to do just that.
And here's the rub. To get this support, conservatives AND Biden have flat out lied about these reforms - particularly around the issue of carjacking.
The reforms took the sentencing for carjacking down from 40 years, which is the highest and harshest in the nation, down to 24 years, which is still the highest and harshest in the nation. And Biden has been parroting Republican talking points saying this is going to make the city less safe.
But here's the thing - DC has the harshest sentencing on carjacking in America right now, and it's STILL a problem. Why? Because 40 years for carjacking doesn't solve the problem. I have a whole lot to say.
Let me unpack and explain it.
To listen to today’s FULL EPISODE of The Breakdown go now to Apple Podcasts or Spotify and search for “The Breakdown with Shaun King.” Subscribe there for FREE and listen to the whole podcast.
If you are already on Apple Podcasts or Spotify, please subscribe, listen, share, leave reviews, and listen daily to the entire episode. The more of it you listen to, the better it is for us.Love and appreciate you all.
Shaun

items.title: Ep. 766 - Yesterday NFL teams did something truly dirty to star quarterback Lamar Jackson

items.content:
As the United States continues the march toward having 400 million people, we are still stuck with an antiquated 2 party system that was created hundreds of years ago.
Do you know how many people lived in this country in 1776? 2.5 million people.
Cramming 400 million into 2 political parties is preposterous. And it's why almost every developed democracy around the world has at least 4, but sometimes has 10-15 parties - all with members in their congress.
If we just had 4 parties, it would at least be a start of more people feeling like they have true political representation.
Let me unpack and explain it.
To listen to today’s FULL EPISODE of The Breakdown go now to Apple Podcasts or Spotify and search for “The Breakdown with Shaun King.” Subscribe there for FREE and listen to the whole podcast.
If you are already on Apple Podcasts or Spotify, please subscribe, listen, share, leave reviews, and listen daily to the entire episode. The more of it you listen to, the better it is for us.
Love and appreciate you all.

items.title: Ep. 765 - If I could have just one wish in politics it would be this...

items.content:
I'm a huge sports fan. And follow the NBA closely as a hobby. Ja Morant, the young Memphis Grizzlies star, is definitely one of my favorite players to watch. My whole family loves him.
But sadly, over the past year, he has had at least 3 incidents with guns, that have made it clear, to say the least, that Ja is not quite on the right path.
Truthfully, a full fledged intervention needed to happen after the first incident. And it never happened. It definitely needed to happen after the second incident. And it never happened. In fact, nothing substantive happened either time.
Then, this weekend, Ja could be seen flashing a gun on his Instagram live, and it seemed to be the straw that broke the camels back. While he's now suspended from the team for what might've been the least dangerous of the 3 incidents we know of, this is bigger than basketball. We need to be thinking about this young man's life.
Let me unpack and explain it.
To listen to today’s FULL EPISODE of The Breakdown go now to Apple Podcasts or Spotify and search for “The Breakdown with Shaun King.” Subscribe there for FREE and listen to the whole podcast.
If you are already on Apple Podcasts or Spotify, please subscribe, listen, share, leave reviews, and listen daily to the entire episode. The more of it you listen to, the better it is for us.Love and appreciate you all.Shaun

items.contentSnippet:
I'm a huge sports fan. And follow the NBA closely as a hobby. Ja Morant, the young Memphis Grizzlies star, is definitely one of my favorite players to watch. My whole family loves him.
But sadly, over the past year, he has had at least 3 incidents with guns, that have made it clear, to say the least, that Ja is not quite on the right path.
Truthfully, a full fledged intervention needed to happen after the first incident. And it never happened. It definitely needed to happen after the second incident. And it never happened. In fact, nothing substantive happened either time.
Then, this weekend, Ja could be seen flashing a gun on his Instagram live, and it seemed to be the straw that broke the camels back. While he's now suspended from the team for what might've been the least dangerous of the 3 incidents we know of, this is bigger than basketball. We need to be thinking about this young man's life.
Let me unpack and explain it.
To listen to today’s FULL EPISODE of The Breakdown go now to Apple Podcasts or Spotify and search for “The Breakdown with Shaun King.” Subscribe there for FREE and listen to the whole podcast.
If you are already on Apple Podcasts or Spotify, please subscribe, listen, share, leave reviews, and listen daily to the entire episode. The more of it you listen to, the better it is for us.Love and appreciate you all.Shaun

items.title: Ep. 763 - Joe Biden just partnered with Republicans to undo criminal justice reforms in Washington DC

items.content:
Do you know who the FBI and Department of Defense says the single biggest threat to the safety and security of America is?
It's damn sure not drag queens?
It's conservative white supremacists.
But somehow, instead of thinking about how they can address the violent racists in their own home, conservatives have decided to do what they always do... play a dangerous smoke and mirrors game where they make their base think the biggest threat to them, and to their kids in particular, are people dressed up in drag.
This is what they always do. They used to focus on Muslims, then immigrants, then someone else, and someone else, and now it's drag queens, but it's all a dangerous ruse to get their base riled up and angry.
And I think it could bring real harm and violence upon people who don't deserve any of it.
Let me unpack and explain it.
To listen to today’s FULL EPISODE of The Breakdown go now to Apple Podcasts or Spotify and search for “The Breakdown with Shaun King.” Subscribe there for FREE and listen to the whole podcast.
If you are already on Apple Podcasts or Spotify, please subscribe, listen, share, leave reviews, and listen daily to the entire episode. The more of it you listen to, the better it is for us.Love and appreciate you all.Shaun

items.title: Ep. 762 - Conservatives truly need to leave drag queens alone. They are about the least harmful group of people in America.

items.content:
The fastest path to the Republican nomination for President is white supremacy. In part, that's why Nikki Haley, who is an Indian American, and Tim Scott, an African American, will never win the nomination.
Nearly 8 years ago, Ta-Nehisi Coates wrote something that actually shocked me - where he called Donald Trump America's "First White President." Of course, America had 43 white presidents before Trump, but what Coates meant is that Trump was the first President to basically run on whiteness and the advancement of white people at the expense of everyone else.
Ron DeSantis is taking that same blueprint and running with it in Florida - first banning the honest teaching of Black history across the state and now defunding and removing all diversity offices at every state college and university - a policy he just announced yesterday.
It's not just outrageous, it's dangerous and deeply problematic. These policies are all about positioning himself to be, to paraphrase Coates, "The Next White President" for white people, by white people.
Let me unpack and explain it.
To listen to today’s FULL EPISODE of The Breakdown go now to Apple Podcasts or Spotify and search for “The Breakdown with Shaun King.” Subscribe there for FREE and listen to the whole podcast.
If you are already on Apple Podcasts or Spotify, please subscribe, listen, share, leave reviews, and listen daily to the entire episode. The more of it you listen to, the better it is for us.
Love and appreciate you all.
Shaun
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.title: Ep. 761 - Ron DeSantis is a white supremacist

items.content:
I don't know if you saw the news, but Florida Governor Ron DeSantis just took over the Disney tax district and literally appointed his homies to run it.
His memoir comes out today.
He's openly homophobic.And is fighting hard to make sure Black history isn't taught in Florida and his base LOVES IT.
In case you missed it, the Republican primaries for President are underway. Trump has announced he's running. Nikki Haley has announced. Senator Tim Scott is up next.
But I truly believe Ron DeSantis will defeat all of them and win the Republican nomination. He's even more conservative than Trump, but without all of the baggage, lawsuits, criminal investigations, ex-wives, failed businesses, etc.
And here's the question that Democrats HAVE TO ANSWER... do you actually think Joe Biden could beat Ron DeSantis. I don't.
I don't even think Joe Biden thinks he could beat him. And that's why Biden should announce he's not running for President and Democrats should have a serious primary for a candidate to defeat Ron DeSantis.
Let me unpack and explain it.To listen to today’s FULL EPISODE of The Breakdown go now to Apple Podcasts or Spotify and search for “The Breakdown with Shaun King.” Subscribe there for FREE and listen to the whole podcast.
If you are already on Apple Podcasts or Spotify, please subscribe, listen, share, leave reviews, and listen daily to the entire episode. The more of it you listen to, the better it is for us.
Love and appreciate you all.
Shaun

items.title: Ep. 760 - Ron DeSantis will win the Republican nomination and absolutely clobber Joe Biden if he's the nominee

items.content:
It's a big decision, TBH. Where you get your news is something that I really want you to think long and hard about.
Who invests in that company? Who runs it? What is their public and private agenda? Who is their core audience?All of those questions have a HUGE impact on what stories they tell, how they tell them, and ultimately impacts what stories they completely ignore.
Because right now I see ALL of the major news organizations almost completely ignoring some of the biggest issues going on in the world.
Let me unpack and explain it.
To listen to today’s FULL EPISODE of The Breakdown go now to Apple Podcasts or Spotify and search for “The Breakdown with Shaun King.” Subscribe there for FREE and listen to the whole podcast.

Because right now I see ALL of the major news organizations almost completely ignoring some of the biggest issues going on in the world.
Let me unpack and explain it.

When you get a chance, go listen to the important new podcast, Alphabet Boys. In it, a brave reporter breaks the news that the FBI planted a paid informant inside of the movement in Denver to not only feed the FBI information, but to destroy the people leading the movement there by trying to get them to commit crimes they had no previous intent to commit.
I have 2 main conclusions that I want to share with you today.
This was definitely happening in every major city in America.
It's still going on today.
Let me unpack and explain it.

items.title: Ep. 758 - We now have proof that the FBI was trying to destroy the Black Lives Matter Movement from the inside out

items.content:
As you have likely seen, a horrible and completely preventable environmental disaster is rapidly getting worse in Ohio - and a ton of blame can go around - from Trump to Biden - and certainly to Norfolk Southern - which owned and operated the train that derailed.
It's super easy for Democrats to blame Trump - who repealed policies that might've prevented this accident. And it's easy for Republicans to blame Biden - who seems to have not only bungled the response to it, but also broke up the union strike that was fighting for better policies, better pay, and more staff for the trains.
But the truth is that both Biden and Trump failed here and both bent over backwards to help the train industry make more money at the cost of safety. And now the chickens have come home to roost.
Let me unpack and explain it.
To listen to today’s FULL EPISODE of The Breakdown go now to Apple Podcasts or Spotify and search for “The Breakdown with Shaun King.” Subscribe there for FREE and listen to the whole podcast.
If you are already on Apple Podcasts or Spotify, please subscribe, listen, share, leave reviews, and listen daily to the entire episode. The more of it you listen to, the better it is for us.
Love and appreciate you all.
Shaun

items.title: Ep. 757 - Both Trump and Biden played a serious role in causing the environmental disaster unfolding in East Palestine, Ohio after the train crash there

items.content:
You wouldn't know it from watching the news today, but at least 10 Palestinians were slaughtered by Israel today - including women, children, and senior citizens. They were shot, bombed, and run over by armored cars. I've seen the videos and photos for myself. It's atrocious. It's despicable. And we have to push back.
The leading human rights organizations in the world call what Israel is doing to Palestinians "Apartheid," but I've grown to think that's not even strong enough. These are war crimes. And more. 2023 is on pace to be the deadliest year ever measured for Palestinians. And don't believe the lies that Israel is just killing "terrorists." They use that blanket excuse to describe everything they do to shut down the truth.
They've killed at least 12 children. Almost everybody that was killed has been unarmed. And they are doing it without even a hint of accountability.
Let me try to unpack and explain it.
To listen to today’s FULL EPISODE of The Breakdown go now to Apple Podcasts or Spotify and search for “The Breakdown with Shaun King.” Subscribe there for FREE and listen to the whole podcast.
If you are already on Apple Podcasts or Spotify, please subscribe, listen, share, leave reviews, and listen daily to the entire episode. The more of it you listen to, the better it is for us.
Love and appreciate you all.
Shaun

items.content:
First off, I'm glad to be back after far too long of a hiatus fighting off a lung infection. Thanks for sticking with me and with the podcast. As you no doubt know, yesterday was President's Day. And I just need to remind us that 99% of the presidents in American history were complete monsters.
If they didn't literally buy, sell, and trade human beings - they oversaw war crimes, genocide, and so much more - right up until today. And it took me a long time to understand just WHY that was.
Ultimately, it all comes down to WHO is teaching you about the history of this country and the world at large.
Let’s talk about it!
To listen to today’s FULL EPISODE of The Breakdown go now to Apple Podcasts or Spotify and search for “The Breakdown with Shaun King.” Subscribe there for FREE and listen to the whole podcast.
If you are already on Apple Podcasts or Spotify, please subscribe, listen, share, leave reviews, and listen daily to the entire episode. The more of it you listen to, the better it is for us.
Love and appreciate you all.
Shaun

items.content:
This is one of those things that we always suspected was happening but never quite had the proof. DC Police Lt. Shane Lamont was feeding the Proud Boys all manner of information for months leading up to January 6th… and somehow still has his job.
Why has he not been fired? Or charged? Are his previous cases going to be reopened? How did he get introduced to the Proud Boys? Was he a member himself? I’ve got questions.
Let’s talk about it!

items.title: Ep. 754 - Turns out a white police lieutenant was informing and collaborating with the Proud Boys ahead of January 6th...and still has his job

items.content:
Hey everybody. I am so glad to be back today after being out sick for the past few weeks. I'm still not fully recovered, but am pretty sure that I'm on the mend.
It wasn't COVID, but started off as a common cold I got from the kids, then it became a sinus and ear infection that spread to my lungs and just will not go away. I go back to the doctor tomorrow after having some tests run yesterday.
But I tell you what, I'm just very grateful that I have been able to take this time off when I needed it. And I couldn't do that without the generous support of everyday people just like yourself.

items.content:
On today’s throwback episode of The Breakdown, the final episode in a 3 part series explaining the leading Supreme Court cases that make police brutality functionally legal in the United States, Shaun gives us action steps and solutions for how we make police brutality illegal. It won’t be easy or quick, but it’s necessary. 

If you haven't already, go listen to Tuesday & Wednesday's episodes to hear part 1 and 2 of the series!
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.content:
Listen to a replay of our 13th episode as Shaun King explores the reasons behind the legality of police brutality in the United States. This is the second episode of a three-part series where Shaun examines the Supreme Court case Graham v. Connor and how it, alongside Tennessee v. Garner, protects police from being held responsible for their brutality. Gain a comprehensive understanding of the legal framework and be ready for the next episode where Shaun will delve into potential solutions to bring about change.

items.title: Graham v. Garner - Police Brutality is Legal - Part 2 of 3 | Replay of Episode 13

items.content:
For Today's episode of The Breakdown, we are going way back and replaying our 12th episode. The first in a 3-part series that dives into the issue of why police brutality is effectively legal in the United States, by analyzing the Supreme Court cases that protect even the most abusive officers. In the first and second episodes, King breaks down the cases and their implications. But in the third episode, he doesn't just leave us with the problem, he offers solutions and empowers us by telling us what we can do to bring about change. Tune in over the next two days to learn about the legal landscape and how we can work toward justice for victims of police brutality.
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.content:
Join us for a thought-provoking episode as we delve into the question, "Are You Racist?" In this episode that was released back in April of 2020, Shaun encourages listeners to reflect on their beliefs and actions and challenges them to strive for not just being "not racist," but actively being anti-racist. With insights from Ibram X. Kendi's book, "How to Be an Antiracist", this episode is a powerful reminder of the work we all must do to create a more just and equitable society. Even if you've heard this episode before, it's worth revisiting. Don't miss this important conversation on the path to becoming an antiracist.
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.title: Are you racist? | Replay of Episode 223

items.content:
For today, we have a replay episode. Released almost a year ago, this necessary lesson from Ep. 576 will forever ring true. We hope you enjoy:
Those words from Dr. King, "Injustice anywhere is a threat to justice everywhere" is a life quote for me. I think about it daily. It has guided much of my life for the past 25 years. And for me, today, those words matter more than ever.
Can I teach for a moment?
Let me unpack and explain for you what I think these words mean. I hate war. I hate what Putin is doing right now to Ukraine. But I see a lot of people saying that none of us should even care. I see people saying the same thing about the horrible decision from the Governor of Texas to criminalize being a parent of a transgender child or teenager. I see people I know actually celebrating this decision. And I have to speak up on why this is wrong and horribly short-sighted. Because truly, "injustice anywhere is a threat to justice everywhere.

"You may see those situations, and think they have nothing to do with you, but when the rights and safety of some people are attacked and eroded, believe me, it's only a matter of time before yours are next.
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.content:
On the evening of October 12th, 2019, a Ft. Worth police officer literally shot and killed Atatiana Jefferson through her bedroom window while she was playing video games with her young nephew, Zion. She was just 28.
Soon after Atatiana was murdered, both of her parents died. And just this week, Amber Carr, who was Zion's mother, just died at the age of 33.
You've heard me say this so many times, but police violence NEVER has just one victim. It ravages entire families. But we now have a chance to step up and buy a new home for Amber's two sons, Zion and Zayden.
If you can, please go now to my Instagram profile and CLICK THE LINK in my bio there. It will take you to a GoFundMe link where we have already blown past 50% of our final goal.
We have advised the family to go ahead and get a realtor. Give the best donation you can, OK?
Love and appreciate each of you!
To listen to today’s FULL EPISODE of The Breakdown go now to Apple Podcasts or Spotify and search for “The Breakdown with Shaun King.” Subscribe there for FREE and listen to the whole podcast.
If you are already on Apple Podcasts or Spotify, please subscribe, listen, share, leave reviews, and listen daily to the entire episode. The more of it you listen to, the better it is for us.
Love and appreciate you all.Shaun
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

itunes.summary:
On the evening of October 12th, 2019, a Ft. Worth police officer literally shot and killed Atatiana Jefferson through her bedroom window while she was playing video games with her young nephew, Zion. She was just 28.
Soon after Atatiana was murdered, both of her parents died. And just this week, Amber Carr, who was Zion's mother, just died at the age of 33.
You've heard me say this so many times, but police violence NEVER has just one victim. It ravages entire families. But we now have a chance to step up and buy a new home for Amber's two sons, Zion and Zayden.
If you can, please go now to my Instagram profile and CLICK THE LINK in my bio there. It will take you to a GoFundMe link where we have already blown past 50% of our final goal.
We have advised the family to go ahead and get a realtor. Give the best donation you can, OK?
Love and appreciate each of you!
To listen to today’s FULL EPISODE of The Breakdown go now to Apple Podcasts or Spotify and search for “The Breakdown with Shaun King.” Subscribe there for FREE and listen to the whole podcast.
If you are already on Apple Podcasts or Spotify, please subscribe, listen, share, leave reviews, and listen daily to the entire episode. The more of it you listen to, the better it is for us.
Love and appreciate you all.Shaun
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.title: Ep. 752 - Let's buy these 2 boys a new home. We are the village. And we are already more than halfway to the goal!

items.content:
Just as the United States Congress has done nothing of substance to move the needle on gun violence and mass shootings and school shootings, even as gun violence literally became the #1 of cause of death for KIDS in America, the same is true of police violence.
Congress will do nothing. They did nothing 2 years ago, in the shadows of the murders of George Floyd and Breonna Taylor, even when Democrats controlled Congress, and they will do nothing now, in the wake of the murder of Tyre Nichols. NOTHING.
Listen to my heart. This is not me being pessimistic. These issues are not really a priority for the voting majority in Congress. Period. And the sooner we accept that, the better.
Because 30 minutes spent lobbying Congress on this issue is 30 minutes of your life that you will never get back. HOWEVER, change can happen, and WILL happen on the city, county, and state level in many places all over the country.
Let me unpack and explain it.
To listen to today’s FULL EPISODE of The Breakdown go now to Apple Podcasts or Spotify and search for “The Breakdown with Shaun King.” Subscribe there for FREE and listen to the whole podcast.
If you are already on Apple Podcasts or Spotify, please subscribe, listen, share, leave reviews, and listen daily to the entire episode. The more of it you listen to, the better it is for us.
Love and appreciate you all.
Shaun

items.content:
You've heard me say this a million times, but it's VERY hard to understand a moment in history when you are in it. But right now, Florida is facing a frightening and deeply concerning moment in history.
And it's not just a horrible sign of things to come, it's a horrible sign of where Florida already is. I am now seeing pictures of school libraries and classroom libraries all over the state with nothing but empty shelves. Students and teachers and parents are devastated. And it's scary on a deep level because it feels to them like they are now a part of an authoritarian regime. And in effect they are.
Let me unpack and explain it.
To listen to today’s FULL EPISODE of The Breakdown go now to Apple Podcasts or Spotify and search for “The Breakdown with Shaun King.” Subscribe there for FREE and listen to the whole podcast.
If you are already on Apple Podcasts or Spotify, please subscribe, listen, share, leave reviews, and listen daily to the entire episode. The more of it you listen to, the better it is for us.
Love and appreciate you all.

Shaun

items.content:
In the shadows of the brutal police murder of 29 year father, Tyre Nichols, I see politicians from the President of the United States on down pulling one of the oldest tricks in the book on all of us.
I see hundreds of them doing it actually. And once you see it, and understand it, you will have a radar for it for the rest of your life.
Let me unpack and explain it.

items.title: Ep. 749 - Let me teach you this very important trick politicians LOVE to pull on police brutality

items.content:
As you likely saw, the 5 Memphis Police Officers who murdered Tyre Nichols have all been fired and charged with his murder. Obviously, charges aren't convictions, but this is progress.

With a brand new police chief and a brand new District Attorney, local voters and organizers in Memphis need a lot of credit for how all of this went down.

What hundreds of police departments and DA's offices have said for generations that simply could not be done, or would take years, Memphis did in days.

And it has truly created a new model not just for the speed of it all, but the true compassion and humanity shown by the police chief and DA.

Let me unpack and explain it.

To listen to today’s FULL EPISODE of The Breakdown go now to Apple Podcasts or Spotify and search for “The Breakdown with Shaun King.” Subscribe there for FREE and listen to the whole podcast.

If you are already on Apple Podcasts or Spotify, please subscribe, listen, share, leave reviews, and listen daily to the entire episode. The more of it you listen to, the better it is for us.

Love and appreciate you all.

Shaun

items.title: Ep. 748 - Memphis has modeled precisely how police brutality must be addressed

items.content:
In all my life, I don't think I've ever shared or bragged about a statement from the police. They are almost always terrible, inhumane, and full of nothing but what we call copaganda designed to protect police.

But last night, Memphis Police Chief CJ Davis, in the shadows of the brutal murder of Tyre Nichols by officers in her department, Chief Davis not only fired the 5 main cops involved, she has made it abundantly clear publicly and privately that everything about what those cops did was absolutely horrible.

I just want you to listen to her entire statement today and see it as a model for what's possible with policing in America. It would be best, of course, for Tyre to be alive, but this is what accountability and humanity should look like.Let me unpack and explain it.

To listen to today’s FULL EPISODE of The Breakdown go now to Apple Podcasts or Spotify and search for “The Breakdown with Shaun King.” Subscribe there for FREE and listen to the whole podcast.

If you are already on Apple Podcasts or Spotify, please subscribe, listen, share, leave reviews, and listen daily to the entire episode. The more of it you listen to, the better it is for us.

Love and appreciate you all.

Shaun

items.title: Ep. 747 - I just need you to hear this statement from the Chief of Police in Memphis. It's the best I've ever heard

items.content:
Mass shootings are now MORE American than apple pie. 300% more Americans have been shot and killed since the start of the war in Ukraine than Ukrainians have been killed in the war.

That's how violent this place is. I know it's our home. But 40 mass shootings in 25 days? How is this sustainable? And what do we do?

Because we are the only nation in the world that has more guns than people. And it's not even close. And as long as we have a staggering 400 million guns (and growing) in circulation, the mass shootings, and all of the other gun violence appears like it will be here to stay.

Let me unpack and explain it.

To listen to today’s FULL EPISODE of The Breakdown go now to Apple Podcasts or Spotify and search for “The Breakdown with Shaun King.” Subscribe there for FREE and listen to the whole podcast.

If you are already on Apple Podcasts or Spotify, please subscribe, listen, share, leave reviews, and listen daily to the entire episode. The more of it you listen to, the better it is for us.

Love and appreciate you all.

Shaun (edited)

items.content:encoded:
Mass shootings are now MORE American than apple pie. 300% more Americans have been shot and killed since the start of the war in Ukraine than Ukrainians have been killed in the war.


That's how violent this place is. I know it's our home. But 40 mass shootings in 25 days? How is this sustainable? And what do we do?


Because we are the only nation in the world that has more guns than people. And it's not even close. And as long as we have a staggering 400 million guns (and growing) in circulation, the mass shootings, and all of the other gun violence appears like it will be here to stay.


Let me unpack and explain it.


To listen to today’s FULL EPISODE of The Breakdown go now to Apple Podcasts or Spotify and search for “The Breakdown with Shaun King.” Subscribe there for FREE and listen to the whole podcast.


If you are already on Apple Podcasts or Spotify, please subscribe, listen, share, leave reviews, and listen daily to the entire episode. The more of it you listen to, the better it is for us.


Love and appreciate you all.


Shaun (edited)
